[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_call()] [Feature version bypass] Can an attacker force execution at feature_version 0-2 to avoid paying CALL_PER_LOCAL costs, enabling functions with massive local variable counts for minimal gas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_call()] [Num locals manipulation] Can num_locals be manipulated independently of actual local count, allowing attacker to pay minimal gas while allocating thousands of locals? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_call()] [Module/function name bypass] The _module_id and _func_name parameters are unused - can attackers call system-critical functions that should cost more gas at standard prices? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_call_generic()] [Type args overflow] Can ty_args.len() cause integer overflow when computing CALL_GENERIC_PER_TY_ARG * NumArgs::new(ty_args.len()), allowing generic functions with thousands of type parameters for minimal gas? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_call_generic()] [Combined overflow] Can the sum CALL_GENERIC_BASE + multiple per-unit costs overflow, wrapping to a small value and enabling extremely complex generic calls for near-zero gas? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_call_generic()] [Feature version 3 bypass] Can downgrading to feature version 2 or below skip charging for num_locals in generic calls, enabling free local variable allocation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_ld_const()] [Size overflow] Can size parameter overflow in LD_CONST_PER_BYTE * size calculation, allowing loading of massive constants for minimal gas and causing memory exhaustion? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_ld_const_after_deserialization()] [Deserialization bypass] This function returns Ok(()) - can attackers load constants that deserialize into massive in-memory structures without paying gas for the expanded size? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_copy_loc()] [Value size manipulation] Can abstract_value_size_stack_and_heap be exploited to underreport actual value sizes, allowing copying of massive data structures for minimal gas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_copy_loc()] [Feature version exploitation] Can an attacker manipulate feature_version() within abstract_value_size calculation to use outdated sizing algorithms that undercharge for modern value types? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_move_loc()] [Fixed cost bypass] MOVE_LOC_BASE is a fixed cost regardless of value size - can attackers move enormous values for the same cost as small ones, enabling cheap memory manipulation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_store_loc()] [Store cost bypass] ST_LOC_BASE is also fixed - can storing massive values to locals consume disproportionate resources versus gas paid? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_pack()] [Args count overflow] Can args.len() as u64 overflow when creating NumArgs, allowing packing structs with billions of fields for minimal gas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/meter.rs] [Function: charge_pack()] [Generic flag manipulation] Can an attacker incorrectly set is_generic to false for generic pack operations to pay lower PACK_BASE instead of PACK_GENERIC_BASE? (Medium)
